As the Penn State Board of Trustees continues to receive pressure for structural and operational reform state Sen PERIOD Andy Dinniman D19th District leads an endeavor to enact change in the universitys governing body PERIOD

Dinnimans communications director Adam Cirucci said the senator Class of  expects the bill that Dinniman introduced  which seeks to reduce the size of the Board of Trustees from  to  members  to be referred to committee sometime this week PERIOD

Specifically it would reduce the members of the board that the governor appoints from six to four the number the alumni elected from nine to six the number county agricultural societies elected from six to four and the number the business and industry groups elected from six to four PERIOD

We are not just going after one group Cirucci said PERIOD

This draft of legislation would also remove the position of the university president from the Board of Trustees and change the status of the governor from a voting to a nonvoting member PERIOD It would further prohibit the president of the university from serving as a trustee secretary or officer of another board or any other committee PERIOD

Senator Dinniman wants to make a clear separation between the board and the university administration PERIOD He feels that the leadership needs to be responsive and needs to be effective Cirucci said PERIOD There needs to be that clear distinction. dinniman further wants to specify that emeriti board members are honorary and thereby do not have the right to vote he said PERIOD

This bill would also change the quorum requirement from seven voting members to the majority of the voting members making it  out of  PERIOD

The senator is also introducing a bill that would put board members administrative members and all applicable employees of staterelated universities including Penn State under the Public Official and Employee Ethics Act which they are not currently under PERIOD This pertains to the Pennsylvania Right to Know law for staterelated universities PERIOD

Legislative Director for Senator Dinniman Martin Indars said the set of legislation for trustee reform known as Senate Bill  was introduced Feb PERIOD  PERIOD

Penn State spokesman David La Torre said via email the Board of Trustees is examining a host of recommendations and is awaiting a report from Faculty Senate PERIOD

Well consider all recommendations including Sen PERIOD Dinnimans in the coming months he added PERIOD

Trustee Anthony Lubrano said via email that he generally supports any effort to improve the governance of Penn State PERIOD

Senator Dinnimans proposed legislation is a welcome step in that direction PERIOD The entire Penn State community should welcome any effort to improve openness and transparency in the governance of the university he said PERIOD
